metadata.title: CVE-2018-10903 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in python-cryptography versions between >=1.9.0 and <2.3.The finalize_with_tag API did not enforce a minimum tag length. If a userdid not validate the input length prior to passing it to finalize_with_tagan attacker could craft an invalid payload with a shortened tag (e.g. 1byte) such that they would have a 1 in 256 chance of passing the MAC check.GCM tag forgeries can cause key leakage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10903` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-cryptography - 2.1.4-1ubuntu1.2
python3-cryptography - 2.1.4-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-cryptography package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.4-1ubuntu1.2').
